row.cell: Arts and Humanities research in the digital era Challenges Which infrastructure?

With thanks to: Reto Speck • A scattered and heterogeneous landscape -Enormous digitization efforts in the public and private sectors • Localization and hosting of digital sources • Documenting and connecting to analog sources Enhance and support digitally-enabled research and teaching across the Arts and Humanities -A long-standing tradition in humanities computing (digital humanities) • Environments for managing, exploring and enriching digital material -Providing technological components to work with digital objects -Some success stories: Text Encoding Initiative, strong communities (Epigraphy, Medieval studies) -Still, a majority of researchers with no real insights about digital -Training researchers and working with communities • Communication of one's own results in the digital world -Providing guidance about standards and best practices sources, methods and publications -General issue of preserving digital results from one research project to another • Ambition: dramatically raising awareness about digital methods in the arts and humanities • Multidisciplinary collaboration with computer science research A connected network of tools, information, people and methodologies • Community acceptance of paradigm changes in a -Pulling together national initiatives transition period -Helping communities to integrate the digital shift
